author: Michael Larabel
description: It was just yesterday that Training Solo was made public as a new speculative execution CPU vulnerability affecting some Intel and Arm CPUs... Today another one is now public for Intel processors: Branch Privilege Injection...
title: Branch Privilege Injection Vulnerability Disclosed For Intel CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: With today's announcement of the AMD EPYC 4005P "Grado" entry-level server processors, up for review today are the EPYC 4565P and EPYC 4585PX processors as the top-end Zen 5 processors for budget server builds and basic bare metal server hosting. With the prior-generation EPYC 4004 series AMD was already leaving over Intel's entry-level Xeon E processors that have become rather embarrassing for the company with its stagnate line-up of low-cost server processors. Now with the AMD EPYC 4005 series, AMD is in an even stronger position and providing a total knock-out to the new Xeon 6300P competition headlined by the Xeon 6369P flagship model.
title: AMD EPYC 4565P & EPYC 4585PX Benchmarks Against Xeon 6369P: EPYC 4005 Champions Entry-Level Server Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last year AMD launched the EPYC 4004 series for taking Ryzen based processor designs into the EPYC segment for entry-level servers with ECC memory support, server designs with BMCs, and various enterprise software certifications and industry qualifications. Today they are launching the EPYC 4005 series as their new Zen 5 based offerings for entry-level / budget server deployments and other instances when not needing as much compute power or connectivity and other high-end features found with the EPYC 9005 "Turin" processors.
title: AMD EPYC 4005 Series Launches For Entry-Level Zen 5 Servers

author: Michael Larabel
description: Canonical provided a status update concerning the Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite powered laptops on the recently released Ubuntu 25.04...
title: Canonical Provides Status Update For Snapdragon X Elite Laptops On Ubuntu 25.04

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Mozilla Firefox source code is now officially available on GitHub as they work to transition from their hg.mozilla.org servers...
title: Firefox Source Code Now Hosted On GitHub

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged for the Mesa 25.2 release next quarter are some further enhancements to the Vulkan ray-tracing support with the RADV open-source driver for AMD's new RDNA4 graphics cards...
title: Mesa 25.2 RADV Merges Ray-Tracing Improvements For Radeon RX 9070 Series / RDNA4

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Rust-written NAK shader compiler used by Mesa's NVK open-source Vulkan driver for NVIDIA GPUs has merged support for SM32 as the "KeplerB" / Kepler 2.0 graphics processors...
title: NAK Compiler For Mesa's NVK Driver Adds Support For More NVIDIA Kepler GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: GNU Screen 5.0.1 has been released to address several security issues...
title: GNU Screen 5.0.1 Released Due To Several Security Vulnerabilities

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following Monday's public disclosure of the "Training Solo" security disclosure for this set of issues affecting multiple generations of Intel processors, new Intel CPU microcode has been released for Linux users as part of the mitigation process...
title: Intel Releases Updated CPU Microcode Due To "Training Solo"

author: Michael Larabel
description: The BeOS-inspired Haiku open-source operating system project has published their April 2025 progress report...
title: Haiku OS Adds Support For More AMD Polaris GPUs & Other Changes In April
